CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. This new polymer , referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible. As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP - DTDPP (numbered as the 9th material in the paragraph)
2. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) (numbered as the new polymer in the paragraph)
3. 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2,5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione
4. 2,6-di(trimethyl-tin)-N-[1-(2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]-pyrrole
5. CHCl3
6. chlorobenzene
7. o-dichlorobenzene
8. PC 70 BM

These are the valid Material Name entities identified from the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDTP - DTDPP (previously mentioned as one of potential μmR-polymers) |
| PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) (new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer) |
| 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2,5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione |
| 2,6-di(trimethyl-tin)-N-[1-(2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]-pyrrole |
| CHCl3 |

| o-dichlorobenzene |
| PC 70 BM |

Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. This new polymer , referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible. As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

1. The photocurrent response of polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm.
   - Property Value: 1 μm (wavelength)

2. The external quantum efficiency (EQE) of PSCs for wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10%.
   - Property Value: less than 10% (percentage)

3. The highest PCE of μmR-polymer was 1.1%.
   - Property Value: 1.1% (percentage)

4. Broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm.
   - Property Value: extending to or surpassing 1 μm (wavelength)

5. A high LUMO energy level.
   - Property Value: high LUMO energy level (energy level)

6. A low HOMO level.
   - Property Value: low HOMO level (energy level)

7. High carrier mobility.
   - Property Value: high carrier mobility (mobility)

8. Good solubility.
   - Property Value: good solubility (solubility)

9. Appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives.
   - Property Value: appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives

10. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) has a broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm.
    - Property Value: broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm

11. High short-circuit current (14.87 mA / cm^2).
    - Property Value: 14.87 mA / cm^2 (current)

12. PCE (2.71%).
    - Property Value: 2.71% (percentage)

13. The number-average molecular weight (Mn) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol.
    - Property Value: 18.9 kg / mol (mass)

14. The polydispersity index (PDI) of the polymer is 2.04.
    - Property Value: 2.04 (dimensionless)

15. TGA plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.
    - Property Value: Figure 1 (figure)

The following values are not presented in the paragraph:

- Open circuit voltage (VOC)
- Energy levels with specific units (eV, Joules, etc.)
- Temperature (for TGA analysis)
- Other physical or chemical properties not mentioned in the paragraph.

  - high carrier mobility to ensure effective charge carrier transport
  - good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives

- In our previous work, we also found the polymer, PDTP - DTDPP, based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmR-polymers
- The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1%, one of highest value for μmR-polymers

- This new polymer, referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu), is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible
- Bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm
- High short-circuit current (14.87 mA / cm^2) and PCE (2.71%) were achieved
- The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2,5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]-pyrrole via a Stille reaction
- The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene
- The number-average molecular weight (Mn) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index (PDI) of 2.04
- Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1
- Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp
